country_not_configured.title: The country has not been configured
country_not_configured.description: No country has been configured, please update the configuration by clicking on the "learn more" button below.

deprecated_yaml.title: The {integration_title} YAML configuration is being removed
deprecated_yaml.description:
Configuring {integration_title} using YAML is being removed.

Your existing YAML configuration has been imported into the UI automatically.

Remove the `{domain}` configuration from your configuration.yaml file and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.

historic_currency.title: The configured currency is no longer in use
historic_currency.description: The currency {currency} is no longer in use, please reconfigure the currency configuration.

legacy_templates_false.title: `legacy_templates` config key is being removed
legacy_templates_false.description:
Nothing will change with your templates.

Remove the `legacy_templates` key from the `homeassistant` configuration in your configuration.yaml file and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.

legacy_templates_true.title: The support for legacy templates is being removed
legacy_templates_true.description:
Please do the following steps:
- Adopt your configuration to support template rendering to native python types.
- Remove the `legacy_templates` key from the `homeassistant` configuration in your configuration.yaml file.
- Restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.

python_version.title: Support for Python {current_python_version} is being removed
python_version.description: Support for running Home Assistant in the current used Python version {current_python_version} is deprecated and will be removed in Home Assistant {breaks_in_ha_version}. Please upgrade Python to {required_python_version} to prevent your Home Assistant instance from breaking.

config_entry_only.title: The {domain} integration does not support YAML configuration
config_entry_only.description:
The {domain} integration does not support configuration via YAML file. You may not notice any obvious issues with the integration, but any configuration settings defined in YAML are not actually applied.

To resolve this:

1. If you've not already done so, [set up the integration]({add_integration}).

2. Remove `{domain}:` from your YAML configuration file.

3. Restart Home Assistant.

platform_only.title: The {domain} integration does not support YAML configuration under its own key
platform_only.description:
The {domain} integration does not support configuration under its own key, it must be configured under its supported platforms.

To resolve this:

1. Remove `{domain}:` from your YAML configuration file.

2. Restart Home Assistant.

no_platform_setup.title: Unused YAML configuration for the {platform} integration
no_platform_setup.description:
It's not possible to configure {platform} {domain} by adding `{platform_key}` to the {domain} configuration. Please check the documentation for more information on how to set up this integration.

To resolve this:
1. Remove `{platform_key}` occurences from the `{domain}:` configuration in your YAML configuration file.
2. Restart Home Assistant.

Example that should be removed:
{yaml_example}

confirm.title: [%key:component::homeassistant::issues::storage_corruption::title%]
confirm.description:
The `{storage_key}` storage could not be parsed and has been renamed to `{corrupt_path}` to allow Home Assistant to continue.

A default `{storage_key}` may have been created automatically.

If you made manual edits to the storage file, fix any syntax errors in `{corrupt_path}`, restore the file to the original path `{original_path}`, and restart Home Assistant. Otherwise, restore the system from a backup.

Click SUBMIT below to confirm you have repaired the file or restored from a backup.

The exact error was: {error}

check_config.name: Check configuration
check_config.description: Checks the Home Assistant YAML-configuration files for errors. Errors will be shown in the Home Assistant logs.

reload_core_config.name: Reload core configuration
reload_core_config.description: Reloads the core configuration from the YAML-configuration.

safe_mode.name: Safe mode
safe_mode.description: Disable custom integrations and custom cards.

toggle.name: Generic toggle
toggle.description: Generic service to toggle devices on/off under any domain.

turn_on.name: Generic turn on
turn_on.description: Generic service to turn devices on under any domain.

turn_off.name: Generic turn off
turn_off.description: Generic service to turn devices off under any domain.

update_entity.name: Update entity
update_entity.description: Forces one or more entities to update its data.

reload_custom_templates.name: Reload custom Jinja2 templates
reload_custom_templates.description: Reloads Jinja2 templates found in the `custom_templates` folder in your config. New values will be applied on the next render of the template.

entry_id.name: Config entry ID
entry_id.description: The configuration entry ID of the entry to be reloaded.

save_persistent_states.name: Save persistent states
save_persistent_states.description: Saves the persistent states immediately. Maintains the normal periodic saving interval.

reload_all.name: Reload all
reload_all.description: Reload all YAML configuration that can be reloaded without restarting Home Assistant.

config_validation_err.message: Invalid config for integration {domain} at {config_file}, line {line}: {error}. Check the logs for more information.

config_validator_unknown_err.message: Unknown error calling {domain} config validator. Check the logs for more information.

config_schema_unknown_err.message: Unknown error calling {domain} CONFIG_SCHEMA. Check the logs for more information.

integration_config_error.message: Failed to process config for integration {domain} due to multiple ({errors}) errors. Check the logs for more information.

platform_component_load_err.message: Platform error: {domain} - {error}. Check the logs for more information.

platform_component_load_exc.message: Platform error: {domain} - {error}. Check the logs for more information.

platform_config_validation_err.message: Invalid config for {domain} from integration {p_name} at file {config_file}, line {line}: {error}. Check the logs for more information.

platform_schema_validator_err.message: Unknown error when validating config for {domain} from integration {p_name}
